content: In the following questions, I will provide you with a graph (given as an array of nodes and an array of edges), a starting point, and a target point. Please return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point in the following format: 1->2->3->4... Please note that your answer should only include the result in this format and should not contain any other words.(Notice that for the same graph, if the start and end points of the problem are swapped, the new shortest path should be the reverse of the original shortest path.)

The shortest path from node 6 to node 10 in the given graph is:

1->6->11->10

Please note that this is the shortest path from node 6 to node 10, and if the start and end points of the problem are swapped, the new shortest path would be the reverse of this path.

The shortest path from node 10 to node 6 in the given graph is:

6->11->10

Note that the path starts and ends at the same node, so there is no need to specify a starting node or an end node in this case. The shortest path between two nodes is the shortest sequence of edges that connects them.
